ofx:section.ofx:title: Constraints and Validity Checks
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Plausibility checks and data constraints are very important. These checks guarantee data validity and consistency. They are carried out in the following ways:

l:item.ofx:paragraph: Most of the are located at database level and enforce the . E.g. deleting an object that is used somewhere else is not allowed.
The Data type constraints are in the and ensure that the entered data types are correct. The system checks that an amount is a decimal number and not a .

The Plausibility checks (e.g. that a national ID needs to start with 1 and requires 16 digits or that a real start date should never be prior to the planned start date) are situated in the application logic.

ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: In all cases, the user interface will inform the when plausibility checks fail or constraints are violated. Constraints are documented in this manual to enhance the understanding of the user of the internal processes of the system.
